sections.heading: What is Ba-conditional?
sections.content:
ば-form (ba-conditional) expresses "if/when" conditions. It's one of the most common conditional forms in Japanese.

食べれば (tabereba) - if/when (you) eat 書けば (kakeba) - if/when (you) write すれば (sureba) - if/when (you) do

children.heading: 1. General Conditions
children.content: 勉強すれば、合格できる "If you study, you can pass" 雨が降れば、行かない "If it rains, I won't go"

children.heading: 2. Natural Consequences
children.content: 春になれば、暖かくなる "When spring comes, it gets warm" 練習すれば、上手になる "If you practice, you'll improve"

children.heading: 3. Hypothetical Situations
children.content: お金があれば、車を買う "If I had money, I'd buy a car" 時間があれば、手伝う "If I have time, I'll help"

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
Drop る , add れば :

食べる → 食べれば (if eat) 見る → 見れば (if see) 寝る → 寝れば (if sleep) 起きる → 起きれば (if wake up) 教える → 教えれば (if teach)

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content:
Change -u to -eba :

書く → 書けば (kaku → kakeba) kak-u → kak-eba 読む → 読めば (yomu → yomeba) yom-u → yom-eba 話す → 話せば (hanasu → hanaseba) hanas-u → hanas-eba 買う → 買えば (kau → kaeba) ka-u → ka-eba 待つ → 待てば (matsu → mateba) mat-u → mat-eba 遊ぶ → 遊べば (asobu → asobeba) asob-u → asob-eba 帰る → 帰れば (kaeru → kaereba) kaer-u → kaer-eba 泳ぐ → 泳げば (oyogu → oyogeba) oyog-u → oyog-eba

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → すれば (if do) 来る → 来れば (くれば, kureba) (if come)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | E-row | Ba-form | Meaning | | ---------- | ------- | -------- | -------- | | 書く | kak-e | 書けば | if write | | 読む | yom-e | 読めば | if read | | 話す | hanas-e | 話せば | if speak | | 買う | ka-e | 買えば | if buy | | 食べる | tabe | 食べれば | if eat | | 見る | mi | 見れば | if see | | する | - | すれば | if do | | 来る | - | 来れば | if come |

sections.heading: Negative Ba-conditional
sections.content:
Use なければ (nakereba):

食べる → 食べなければ (if don't eat) 行く → 行かなければ (if don't go) する → しなければ (if don't do)

Pattern: Nai-form (ない) → なければ

食べない → 食べなければ 行かない → 行かなければ 来ない → 来なければ

children.heading: ～ば、～ (If A, then B)
children.content: 勉強すれば、合格する "If you study, you'll pass" 早く起きれば、間に合う "If you wake up early, you'll make it" 頑張れば、できる "If you try hard, you can do it"

children.heading: ～なければならない (Must)
children.content:
勉強しなければならない "I must study" 行かなければならない "I must go" 食べなければならない "I must eat"

Shortened: なければ → なきゃ (casual)

勉強しなきゃ "I gotta study" 行かなきゃ "I gotta go"

children.heading: ～ばいい (Should)
children.content: 勉強すればいい "You should study" 早く寝ればいい "You should sleep early" 聞けばいい "You should ask"

children.heading: ～ば～ほど (The more... the more...)
children.content: 練習すればするほど上手になる "The more you practice, the better you get" 食べれば食べるほど太る "The more you eat, the fatter you get" 見れば見るほど好きになる "The more I see it, the more I like it"

children.heading: い-adjectives
children.content:
Remove い , add ければ :

高い → 高ければ (if expensive) 大きい → 大きければ (if big) おいしい → おいしければ (if delicious)

Negative:

高くない → 高くなければ (if not expensive)

children.heading: な-adjectives
children.content:
Add であれば or なら :

静か → 静かであれば (if quiet) 便利 → 便利であれば (if convenient)

Casual: なら is more common

静かなら (if quiet) 便利なら (if convenient)

sections.heading: Ba-conditional vs Other Conditionals
sections.content:
| Form | Usage | Example | | ---- | ------------------ | --------------------- | | ば | General condition | 行けば (if go) | | たら | Specific condition | 行ったら (if/when go) | | と | Natural result | 行くと (when go) | | なら | Topic condition | 行くなら (if going) |

Ba = most versatile conditional!

children.heading: Proverbs
children.content: 急がば回れ "If you hurry, take a detour" (= Haste makes waste) 虎穴に入らずんば虎子を得ず "If you don't enter the tiger's den, you can't get the cub" (= Nothing ventured, nothing gained)

children.heading: Daily Use
children.content: 分からなければ、聞いてください "If you don't understand, please ask" 暇があれば、遊びに来て "If you have free time, come visit" 雨が降れば、中止です "If it rains, it's cancelled"

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 明日行く？ "Are you going tomorrow?" B: 天気が良ければ行く "If the weather is good, I'll go" A: 雨が降れば？ "If it rains?" B: 行かない "I won't go"

children.heading: Example 2: Advice
children.content: A: どうすればいいですか？ "What should I do?" B: 先生に聞けばいいよ "You should ask the teacher" A: 分からなければ、どうする？ "If I don't understand, what do I do?" B: もう一度聞けばいい "You should ask again"

children.heading: Example 3: Conditions
children.content: A: 時間があれば手伝ってくれる？ "If you have time, will you help me?" B: うん、いいよ "Yeah, sure" A: いつがいい？ "When is good?" B: 明日なら大丈夫 "Tomorrow is fine"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Past Tense After Ba
children.content:
Wrong: 食べれば、食べました ❌ Right: 食べれば、食べます ✓ "If I eat, I will eat" (sounds weird but grammatically correct) Wrong: 行けば、行った ❌ Right: 行けば、行く ✓

Rule: Result clause usually uses non-past!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong E-row Conjugation
children.content: Wrong: 書く → 書くば ❌ Right: 書く → 書けば ✓ Wrong: 読む → 読むば ❌ Right: 読む → 読めば ✓

children.heading: Mistake 3: Confusing with Potential Form
children.content: Ba-form: 書けば (if write) Potential: 書ける (can write) Context makes it clear!

children.heading: Mistake 4: Using for Requests
children.content: Unnatural: 見れば ❌ (as request) Natural: 見てください ✓ "Please look" Ba-form isn't for requests!

children.heading: 1. Commands/Requests
children.content: Wrong: 食べれば ❌ Right: 食べてください ✓

children.heading: 2. Past Hypotheticals (use たら)
children.content: Less natural: 昨日行けば... Natural: 昨日行ったら... ✓ "If I had gone yesterday..."

children.heading: 3. First-time Discoveries
children.content: Wrong: 家に帰れば、誰もいなかった ❌ Right: 家に帰ったら、誰もいなかった ✓ "When I got home, no one was there"

sections.heading: Ba-form in Formal Writing
sections.content:
Common in formal contexts:

問題があれば、ご連絡ください "If there are any problems, please contact us" ご質問があれば、お答えします "If you have questions, I will answer" 不明な点があれば、お聞きください "If anything is unclear, please ask"

sections.heading: Practice Sentences
sections.content: 早く起きれば、間に合う "If you wake up early, you'll make it" 一生懸命勉強すれば、合格できる "If you study hard, you can pass" 毎日練習すれば、上手になる "If you practice every day, you'll improve" 天気が良ければ、ピクニックに行こう "If the weather is good, let's go on a picnic" 時間がなければ、明日にしよう "If there's no time, let's do it tomorrow" 分からなければ、質問してください "If you don't understand, please ask" お金があれば、旅行したい "If I had money, I'd like to travel" 暇があれば、遊びに来てください "If you have free time, please come visit"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Ba-form = "if/when" condition ✓ Godan: -u → -eba ✓ Ichidan: -ru → -reba ✓ Negative: ない → なければ ✓ Natural consequences and hypotheticals ✓ なければならない = must ✓ ～ばいい = should ✓ Most versatile conditional ✓ Result clause uses non-past

Master ba-conditional - essential for expressing conditions!
